title: Developing Backbone.js Applications
author: Addy Osmani
description: In this book we will explore MVC theory and how to build applications using Backbone's models, views, collections and routers.

title: Javascript Guide
author: Mozilla Developer Network
description: JavaScript is a cross-platform, object-based scripting language. This guide explains everything you need to know about using JavaScript.

title: JavaScript For Cats
author: Max Ogden
description: An in-browser interactive introductory programming text designed for cats. Humans are probably also capable of following along.

title: Javascript Design Patterns
author: Addy Osmani
description: In this book we will explore applying both classical and modern design patterns to the JavaScript programming language

title: Writing Modular JavaScript With AMD, CommonJS & ES Harmony
author: Addy Osmani
description: In this article, we're going to look at three formats for writing modular JavaScript: AMD, CommonJS and proposals for the next version of JavaScript, Harmony.

author: Alex MacCaw
description: This book is designed to help you learn CoffeeScript, understand best practices and start building awesome client side applications.

author: Ivo Wetzel
description: A collection of documentation about the most quirky parts of JavaScript.

title: The little MongoDB book
author: Karl Seguin
description: Discover NoSQL with MongoDB and commons Javascript usage patterns.

title: Mixu's Node book
author: Mikito Takada
description: A comprehensive and interesting NodeJS overview covering many aspects in details.

title: Single page apps in depth
author: Mikito Takada
description: Learn the best practices for implementing single page web apps.

title: Mastering NodeJS
author: TJ Holowaychuk
description: In Mastering Node we will discover how to write high concurrency web servers,…

title: JS The Right Way
author: William Oliveira
description: An easy-to-read, quick reference for JS best practices, accepted coding standards, and links around the Web.

title: Programming Windows 8 Apps
author: Devon Musgrave
description: [NOTE : Download needed]This book is about writing Windows Store apps using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.

title: CoffeeScript Cookbook
author: Multiple Owner
description: CoffeeScript recipes for the community by the community.

title: DOM Enlightenment
author: Cody Lindley
description: Exploring the relationship between JavaScript and the modern HTML DOM

title: Bootstrap, Responsive Web Development
author: Jake Spurlock
description: Discover how easy it is to design killer interfaces and responsive websites with the Bootstrap framework. This practical book gets you started building pages with Bootstrap’s HTML/CSS-based tools and design templates right away. You’ll also learn how to extend your app with interactive features, using its suite of jQuery plugins—often without writing a single line of code.

title: Art of Node
author: Max Odgen
description: a free short e-book that teaches you the fundamentals of Node.js by Max Odgen, a popular Node supporter

title: Stream handbook
author: James Halliday (substack)
description: a free short e-book that teaches you how to write node programs with streams, by James Halliday a famous NodeJS supporter that published numerous awesome NodeJS modules

title: Speaking Javascript
author: Axel Rauschmayer
description: Like it or not, JavaScript is everywhere these days—from browser to server to mobile—and now you, too, need to learn the language or dive deeper than you have. This concise book guides you into and through JavaScript, written by a veteran programmer who once found himself in the same position.

title: ECMAscript language reference
author: various authors
description: Learn all about the Javacript language specifications with this official ECMA-262 bible.

title: Human Javascript
author: Henrik Joreteg
description: Practical patterns for simple but powerful javascript apps. No magic frameworks. No monolithic toolkits. You're going to work with proper, real-life javascript in a way you'll understand, and with explanations that help you learn how to make great choices as you build your apps.

title: Understanding ECMAScript 6
author: Nicholas C. Zakas
description: ECMAScript 6 is coming, are you ready? There's a lot of new concepts to learn and understand. Get a headstart with this book!

title: Javascript Challenges
author: Tomas Corral
description: A book to challenge your knowledge about the most obscure parts of Javascript. Learn with us and don't be afraid again of Javascript.

title: The offline cookbook
author: Jake Archibald
description: Excellent overview and recipes using the current offline browsers capabilities

title: Exploring ES6
author: Axel Rauschmayer
description: Upgrade to the next version of JavaScript

title: SurviveJS - Webpack
author: Juho Vepsäläinen
description: Learn to understand Webpack, the bundler.

title: SurviveJS - React
author: Juho Vepsäläinen
description: Learn how to build a Kanban application using React.

title: Mostly adequate guide to functional programming
author: Brian Lonsdorf (DrBoolean)
description: Pure Happiness with Pure Functions

title: The introduction to Reactive Programming you've been missing
author: André Staltz (andrestaltz)
description: So you're curious in learning this new thing called Reactive Programming, particularly its variant comprising of Rx, Bacon.js, RAC, and others.

title: AngularJS Directives in Traction
author: Amit Gharat
description: This eBook helps you understand how built-in directives work and teaches you to build custom directives on your own.

title: Exploring ES2016 and ES2017
author: Dr. Axel Rauschmayer
description: “Exploring ES2016 and ES2017” is a living book. Much content is still to come! Buy it to stay up to date on what is in ECMAScript 2016 and ECMAScript 2017

title: The JavaScript Way
author: Baptiste Pesquet
description: A modern introduction to an essential language: beginner-friendly yet comprehensive, standards-aligned, hands-on and easy to follow.
